title: Yorkshire vet Julian Norton scotches mayoral race claims
description: The Yorkshire Vet Julian Norton has scotched speculation that he is being lined up as the Liberal Democrat candidate to become North Yorkshire and York’s first elected mayor. The TV personality and veterinary surgeon moved to distance himself from claims ...

title: Almost £1 million spent on severance pay for Tory ministers during year of leadership chaos
description: Despite being in jobs for mere weeks as Boris Johnson left and Liz Truss briefly held the premiership, all left with at least £16,876

title: Police-recorded shoplifting offences in England and Wales jump 32%
description: It is the first time since current records began in 2002/03 that the number recorded by police has risen higher than 400,000.

title: Get the great chieftain o’ the puddin-race exported to the United States – Carmichael makes call ahead of Burns Night
description: Orkney and Shetland MP, Alistair Carmichael, has today called for fresh action by trade ministers to open up exports of traditional Scottish haggis to the United States, ahead of Burns Night this evening.

title: Slough and Windsor election predictions: Could a lot change?
description: The Conservative party face the prospect of large-scale losses in key battlegrounds across the UK if there was a general election

title: Local MPs go head to head in public pre-election debate
description: East Devon MP Simon Jupp and Lib Dem MP Richard Foord, who will compete for the Honiton & Sidmouth seat in the General Election, will take

title: Government funding announcement criticised by Lib Dem leader
description: However, the announcement was been criticised by the leader of the Liberal Democrat group at Cornwall Council, with the council reported to be needing an additional £57-million due to an increase in demand for services and inflationary pressures.

title: Park Street: 95-home development on farmland refused
description: Plans for almost 100 homes on farmland in Park Street, near St Albans, have been thrown out. M Scott Properties asked St Albans City and District Council for permission to build 95 homes west of A5183 Watling Street in a 2022 application.

title: Lib Dems will 'bring back community policing', says new PCC candidate
description: Paul Kennedy has been confirmed as the Liberal Democrat candidate bidding to oust the Conservatives in Surrey’s Police and Crime Commissioner (PCC) elections on May 2, 2024.

title: Politics latest news: Tories ‘serve no purpose’, says Farage after Reform records highest ever support
description: Nigel Farage claimed the Red Wall will desert the Tories at the next general election with Rishi Sunak as leader. Mr Farage said that with Mr Sunak leading the Conservative Party “the Red Wall is completely and utterly gone”.

title: Reform UK won't field candidate for York and North Yorkshire mayor
description: Reform UK has confirmed that it will not field a candidate in May’s York and North Yorkshire’s mayoral election.

title: Scot Lib Dems comment on Jason Leitch at UK Covid Inquiry
description: Responding to Jason Leitch’s appearance at the UK Covid Inquiry which heard that, in addition to describing the deletion of his WhatsApps as a ‘pre-bed ritual’, the National Clinical Director also adv

title: Nearly 6,000 unsolved crimes a day last year
description: The Liberal Democrats accuse the Conservatives of “failing” to tackle crime as new Home Office statistics reveal that 40% of all crimes went unsolved last year, while only 6% resulted in a suspect being charged.

title: Donna Harris selected to represent the Liberal Democrats as the Party’s parliamentary candidate for Dulwich & West Norwood.
description: Donna Harris has been selected to represent the Liberal Democrats as the Party’s parliamentary candidate for Dulwich & West Norwood. Donna was elected as a Councillor in May 2022 and she is the Liberal Democrat Leader of the Opposition at Lambeth Council.

title: Tory MSP criticised over bid for Westminster seat
description: This means that if Mr Lamont were to win the seat, held by the Liberal Democrats’ Michael Moore with a majority of 5901, then he would have two parliamentary jobs. Labour seized on this prospect -- as did the Liberal Democrats -- saying that this was an ...

title: Ousted Lib Dem leader feels ‘badly let down’
description: Cllr Brazil, who led the party at Devon County Council until this month but still heads it in South Hams, said he feels “badly let down” by his group, who he said had contacted him without warning to demand he stood down. His replacement as the party’s leader at Conservative-controlled Devon is Councillor Caroline Leaver (Barnstaple South).

title: Rules against exporting haggis to US are a ‘scandal’
description: Rules preventing the export of haggis to the United States are a “scandal”, the Commons has heard. Liberal Democrat MP Alistair Carmichael said the Business Secretary should make progress on the issue of exporting the “great chieftain o’ the puddin-race” or risk being known as a “cowrin, tim’rous beastie”.

title: Politics latest news: Reform UK climbs to highest ever level of support
description: Reform UK has climbed to its highest ever level of support, according to a new YouGov poll. The survey, conducted between Jan 23-24, put Reform on 13 per cent of the vote, up by o

title: MP: Government fell for Tata Steel’s empty bluff to walk away from Port Talbot
description: Business minister Nusrat Ghani said the UK Government’s commitment to the steel sector is ‘clear’ given it is investing in the South

title: Rules against exporting haggis to US a ‘scandal’, MP tells Commons
description: Speaking in the Commons, Mr Carmichael (Orkney and Shetland) said: “Is it not a scandal that the only way you can get the ‘great chieftain o’ the puddin-race’ exported into the United States is if you send the vegetarian version?

title: Shoplifting “epidemic” as offences rise by a third in past year
description: The Liberal Democrats have accused the Conservative Government of overseeing a “shoplifting epidemic” as new statistics reveal shoplifting offences have risen by a third in the past year.

title: Support grows for new GP surgery
description: Cheltenham's Lib Dem parliamentary candidate is calling for a new GP surgery for the town. House of Commons Library research commissioned by the Liberal Democrats shows that funding for GP practices in Gloucestershire has been slashed in real terms since 2019.

title: Labour holds huge 34-point lead in key marginal seats, YouGov poll finds
description: Labour holds a mammoth lead over the Tories in the key marginals it needs to win a majority at the general election, a new YouGov poll has found. Sir Keir Starmer ’s party is an incredible 34 points ahead of Rishi Sunak ’s party in 150 crucial target constituencies.

title: Two charts that reveal a key weakness in Trump’s reelection bid
description: Trump stormed to victory in New Hampshire’s Republican primary – but his biggest challenge will be winning over independent voters.

title: The Looming Contest Between Two Presidents and Two Americas
description: WASHINGTON — Each of them has sat behind the Resolute Desk in the Oval Office, signed bills into law, appointed judges, bartered with foreign leaders and ordered the armed forces into combat. They both know what it is like to be the most powerful person ...
